verb.description: Form or cause to form into a curved or spiral shape.
examples: her fingers curled around the microphone
a slice of ham had begun to curl up at the edges
she used to curl her hair with rags

verb.description: (in weight training) lift (a weight) using only the hands, wrists, and forearms.
Play at the game of curling.

noun.description: Something having a spiral or inwardly curved form, especially a lock of hair.
examples: her blond hair was a mass of tangled curls

noun.description: A weightlifting exercise involving movement of only the hands, wrists, and forearms.
The vector product of the operator del and a given vector.

phrases: There are things going in in this world that make your hair curl.
Whatever your politics, it will make your hair curl.
Some of the bad guys there did things that would probably make even your hair curl - and I don't even want to give you any ideas.
The string of expletives that then emitted from the phone would make you hair curl.
The last information he had received was from survivors, and it was horrifying, that it would make a man 's hair curl.
origin: Late Middle English: from obsolete crulle curly, from Middle Dutch krul.
